The Philadelphia Museum of Art (PMA) is in the process of revamping its collection and is preparing to open a new twenty-three-thousand-square-foot wing in 2020. PMA director Michael Walker told the Philadelphia Inquirer that the museum was working with architect James S. McDonnell to create the new building, which will include spaces for a staged residency program, a contemporary art museum, an open-studio gallery, a new rarified garden, and various public spaces.The redesign of the museum will incorporate elements from the institution’s existing buildings, including the Benjamin Franklin’s first home in Philadelphia and the Pennsylvania Museum of Art (PMA). The PMA will also incorporate a new state-of-the-art collection building, a new terrace, and an element of community engagement.
